title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Tesla reveals slightly cheaper ‘standard’ versions of the Model 3 and Model Y
items.description: The long-awaited cheaper Model 3 and Model Y are finally here, but they start at $36,990 and $39,990, respectively -- just a few thousand dollars less...

items.title: 75 Best Prime Day Deals Under $100 (2025): Chargers, Earbuds, and More
items.description: We've scoured Amazon for the best deals under a Benjamin, from Roku to Instant Pot.

items.title: Trump’s DOE proposes cutting billions in grants for GM, Ford, and lots of startups
items.description: Trump's Department of Energy wants to cancel billions more in awards that were granted by the Biden administration, and startups are in the crosshairs...

items.title: How Otter.ai’s CEO is pushing the company to be more than just a meeting scribe
items.description: Otter is launching a suite of enterprise tools to help companies use its tech to create a central knowledge base.

items.title: Best Prime Day Beauty Deals 2025: Hair, Skin, and Deodorant
items.description: Amazon Prime Day’s a great time for beauty bargains. We tested the gadgets, tracked the prices, and scanned hundreds of deals to find what's worth it.

items.title: 26 Best Prime Day Tech Deals: Tablets, Accessories, and More
items.description: Take advantage of these discounts, courtesy of Amazon’s latest sale event, and nab WIRED’s favorite tech gadgets.

items.title: Wall Street analysts explain how AMD’s own stock will pay for OpenAI’s billions in chip purchases
items.description: AMD's unusual deal to finance OpenAI's chip purchases could grant the AI model maker up to $100 billion, analyst estimates.

items.title: The Tesla Model Y and Model 3 Standard Are Cheaper—but Still Not Cheap
items.description: The electric vehicle tax credit is gone, and Tesla's new, more affordable models don't quite close the gap.

items.title: Google launches its AI vibe-coding app Opal in 15 more countries
items.description: The app, which lets you create mini web apps using text prompts, is now available in Canada, India, Japan, South Korea, Vietnam, Indonesia, Brazil, Si...

items.title: Ted Cruz Targets Wikipedia Over ‘Ideological Bias’
items.description: In a letter to the Wikimedia Foundation CEO, Cruz accused the beloved online resource of being too liberal.
